description: An engine fails during climb due to a known vibration issue that was repeatedly deferred by maintenance under a cost-saving policy. The failure is traceable to an organizational decision.

telemetry_events.description: Engine 1 experiences severe vibration and EGT spike, leading to failure.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Pilot reported noticeable vibration from Engine 1 during climb, especially above 85% N1.
maintenance_logs.action: Ground test performed. Vibration present but within acceptable limits. Monitored for trend.

maintenance_logs.report: PIREP: Increased vibration from Engine 1 noted again. Request engineering review.
maintenance_logs.action: Engineering review deferred due to high operational tempo and budget constraints for non-essential parts replacement. Per company policy, deferral is authorized if vibration is below critical limit.
Engine 1 vibration noted as 'trending up' but still within deferred maintenance policy limits. No action taken.

transcript.sound: Loud bang followed by severe shuddering vibration.

transcript.speaker: FO
transcript.dialogue: Master warning! ECAM, engine fire procedure.

context_data.company_policy_excerpt: Memo #2021-04: To reduce operational costs, non-critical component replacements may be deferred until the next major scheduled maintenance check, provided that performance metrics remain within published deferral limits.
